alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 9:12PM EDT until April 30 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River Near Stony Creek affecting Sussex County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River Near Stony Creek. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Lowlands on the right hand side upstream of the gage begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Friday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 15.6 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning to 11.5 feet early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.6 feet on 11/13/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 915 AM EDT.
